main_definition: To do or say something more than once.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Occurring again and again in the same way.
meanings_and_examples.example: She repeated her mistake by forgetting to save her work before closing the program.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Asked or done repeatedly, usually out of habit or lack of creativity.
meanings_and_examples.example: He kept repeating the same jokes during the meeting, which made everyone lose interest.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Done or expressed more than once; said again or in various ways.
meanings_and_examples.example: The teacher repeated the instructions several times to ensure that all students understood them.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Repeatedly doing an action, often with little variation or change over time.
meanings_and_examples.example: His repetitive work routine left him feeling uninspired and bored.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Referring to something that has occurred multiple times in the past.
meanings_and_examples.example: There have been repeated instances of this problem throughout the company's history.
